screens.question: What differentiates a Jade Lizard from an iron condor?
screens.explanation_correct: Right. Unlike condors, Jade Lizards sell a naked put, creating undefined downside risk.

screens.headline: Why "no upside risk"?
screens.question: Sell $105/$110 call spread for $3 and sell $90 put for $3. Total credit $6. If stock > $110, what happens?

screens.explanation: Max call-side loss is spread width ($5) minus collected call credit, but since total credit ($6) â‰¥ $5, you still net a profit even at maximum call loss.
screens.teaching_point: Upside covered by credit; downside remains the real risk.
